description: Aligns single-end reads by STAR for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.

name: dnase-qc-bam

description: bedToBigBed takes a standard bed file or a non-standard bed file with associated .as file to create a compressed bigBed version.  Description of Big Binary Indexed (BBI) files and visualization of next-generation sequencing experiment results explained by W.J. Kent, PMCID: PMC2922891.
name: bedToBigBed
title: bedToBigBed

description: Signal generation for small-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: srna-signals
title: srna-signals

description: A software package for estimating gene and isoform expression levels from RNA-Seq data.  RSEM has enabled valuable guidance for cost-efficient design of quantification experiments with RNA-Seq, which is currently relatively expensive.
name: rsem
title: RSEM

description: Cutadapt finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequence from your high-throughput sequencing reads.
name: cutadapt
title: cutadapt

description: A tool to map bisulfite converted sequence reads and determine cytosine methylation states.  The output produced by Bismark discriminates between cytosines in CpG, CHG and CHH context and enables bench scientists to visualize and interpret their methylation data soon after the sequencing run is completed (PMID: 21493656).
name: bismark
title: Bismark

description: Aligns single-end reads by STAR for small-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: srna-align
title: srna-align

description: Convert a Bismark CX_report file to bed-like files
name: cxrepo-bed.py
title: WGBS output processor

description: Indexing of reference genome by RSEM for long-RNA-seq ECODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-index-rsem
title: lrna-index-rsem

description: The binary bigWig format can be converted to the text based wig or bedGraph formats using this utility.
name: bigwigtowig
title: bigWigToWig

description: Indexing of reference genome by STAR for long-RNA-seq ECODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-index-star
title: lrna-index-star

description: BWA is a software package for mapping low-divergent sequences based on a Burrows-Wheeler index against a large reference genome, such as the human genome.  Publications for the short read alignment component is found at PMID: 19451168, while PMID: 20080505 outlines the algorithm to align sequences >200bp up to 1Mb.
name: bwa
title: BWA

description: Hotspot2 replaces the previous long running hotspot package.
name: hotspot2
title: hotspot2

description: Bowtie is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner. It aligns short DNA sequences (reads) to the human genome at a rate of over 25 million 35-bp reads per hour. Bowtie indexes the genome with a Burrows-Wheeler index to keep its memory footprint small: typically about 2.2 GB for the human genome (2.9 GB for paired-end).
name: bowtie
title: Bowtie

description: This program will trim adapters from pair-end sequencing tags produced using the Illumina(c) platform.
name: trim-adapters-illumina
title: trim-adapters-illumina

description: Calculates the Median Absolute Deviation (MAD) and correlation of two gene quantifications from replicate RNA-seq experiments.  A measure of reproducibility, inversely correlated with data quality.
name: mad
title: Median Absolute Deviation

description: Mean Absolute Deviation (MAD) and correlation calculated from two replicates for small-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: srna-mad-qc
title: srna-mad-qc

description: MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data, and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across samples
name: miso
title: Miso

description: Alignment by bowtie1 for single-end WGBS (dna-methylation) experiments for ENCODE uniform processing pipeline
name: dme-align-se
title: dme-align-se-parallel

description: Repository for Uniform processing of DNase Hypersensitivity (DNaseHS) and Digital Genomic Footprinting (DGF) though pipelines as implemented by the ENCODE DCC.
name: dnase_pipeline
title: DNase Pipeline

description: Signal generation for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-signals
title: lrna-signals

description: MATS is a computational tool to detect differential alternative splicing events from RNA-Seq data.
name: rmats
title: rMATs

description: Signal generation from stranded alignments for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-signals-stranded
title: lrna-signals-stranded

description: Collect some basic characterization statistics of a BAM file.
name: edwBamStats
title: edwBamStats

description: Python module warapping htslib C-API and samtools for accessing sam formatted alignment files
name: pysam
title: Pysam

description: Generalized RNA Integration Tool: Transcript prediction utilizing RNA-seq and gene boundary information.
name: grit
title: GRIT

description: Quantification of annotation results by RSEM for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-quantification
title: lrna-quantification

description: Calculates correlation between two replicate DNase signals.
name: chromcor
notes: This script was developed at the Stam lab but resides in the DCC pipeline github
title: chromCor.Rscript

description: Signal generation from unstranded alignments for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-signals-unstranded
title: lrna-signals-unstranded

description: Cuffdiff can be used to find significant changes in transcript expression, splicing, and promoter use.
name: cuffdiff
title: Cuffdiff

description: Correlates two WGBS replicate CpG methylation results for ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dme-rep-corr
title: dme-rep-corr

description: overlap_peaks.py is a method to select overlapping peaks among replicates and psuedo-replicates
name: overlap_peaks
title: overlap_peaks.py

description: Peak calling by GRIT for Rampage ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: rampage-peaks
title: rampage-peaks

description: Calculates spearman correlation of 2 replicate bedmethyl files of CpG methylation.
name: bedmethyl_corr.py
notes: Based upon code sample sent by Junko Tsuji
title: CpG methylation correlation

description: Generates normalized density signal from aligned and filtered reads for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-density
title: dnase-density

description: Trim Galore! is a wrapper script to automate quality and adapter trimming as well as quality control, with some added functionality to remove biased methylation positions for RRBS sequence files (for directional, non-directional (or paired-end) sequencing).
name: trim_galore
title: Trim Galore

description: Merges and filters single-end aligned reads for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-filter-se
title: dnase-filter-se

description: This is the git repository for all DNA methylation (WGBS) uniform pipeline code dun on dnanexus by the ENCODE DCC.
name: dna-me-pipeline
notes: This pipeline is AKA: "WGBS", "dme", "dna-me", "meth", "meth-pipe" and perhaps a couple more short and sweet epitaphs
title: DNA-me pipeline

description: Fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.
name: tophat
title: TopHat

description: Evaluates a sample of paired or single-end aligned and filtered reads for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-eval-bam
title: dnase-eval-bam

name: dme-index-bismark
title: dme-index-bismark

description: tophat_bam_xsA_tag_fix.pl was written by x wei to allow the use of tophat 2.0.8 in the ENCODE pipelines.  It reads a bam file generated from paired-ended fastqs by tophat 2.0.8 and corrects the XS:A:+ or XS:A:- tags showing read strandedness.
name: tophat_bam_xsA_tag_fix.pl
title: Tophat BAM Repair

description: Aligns single-end reads by TopHat for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-align-tophat-se
title: lrna-align-tophat-se

description: Creates a wiggle file from an alignment (bam) file.
name: makewigglefromBAM-NH
title: makewigglefromBAM-NH

description: Alignment by bowtie2 for paired-end WGBS (dna-methylation) experiments for ENCODE uniform processing pipeline
name: dme-align-pe
title: dme-align-pe

description: DESeq is an R package to analyse count data from high-throughput sequencing assays such as RNA-Seq and test for differential expression.
name: deseq
title: DESeq

description: Convert bedGraph to bigWig file.  Description of Big Binary Indexed (BBI) files and visualization of next-generation sequencing experiment results explained by W.J. Kent, PMCID: PMC2922891
name: bedgraphtobigwig
title: bedGraphToBigWig

description: Extracts DNA-methylation from WGBS single-end alignments for ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dme-extract-se
title: dme-extract-se

description: Aligns paired-end reads by BWA for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-align-bwa-pe
title: dnase-align-bwa-pe

description: A very efficient implemenation of the the Maximal Overlap Discrete Wavelet Tranform (MODWT). See D. B. Percival and A. T. Walden (2000), Wavelet Methods for Time Series Analysis. Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press. This is not the usual discrete wavelet transform found in, for example, gsl but an extended set of algorithms designed to overcome some problems with the usual discrete wavelet transform.
name: modwt
title: modwt

description: Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences. It is particularly good at aligning reads of about 50 up to 100s or 1,000s of characters, and particularly good at aligning to relatively long (e.g. mammalian) genomes. Bowtie 2 indexes the genome with an FM Index to keep its memory footprint small: for the human genome, its memory footprint is typically around 3.2 GB. Bowtie 2 supports gapped, local, and paired-end alignment modes.
name: bowtie2
title: Bowtie 2

description: Repository of all RNA-seq (long-, small-, and rampage) ENCODE Uniform processing pipelines.
name: rna-pipelines
title: RNA pipelines

description: Mott-Trimmer for WGBS reads
name: mott-trim.py
title: Mott Trimmer

description: Aligns paired-end reads by STAR for Rampage ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: rampage-align
title: rampage-align

description: Concat-fastqs is an applet available for DNA-nexus to concatenate a set of fastqs that should be merged for analysis.
name: concat-fastqs
title: Concat-fastq

description: A widely-used, fast, robust ChIP-seq peak-finding algorithm that accounts for the offset in forward-strand and reverse-strand reads to improve resolution and uses a dynamic Poisson distribution to effectively capture local biases in the genome.  MACS 1.4 was used in the ENCODE 2 uniform peak calling pipeline.
name: macs
title: MACS

description: Converts WGBS Bismark context report to bed and bigBed file formats for ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dme-cx-to-bed
title: dme-cx-to-bed

description: Identifies regions of local enrichment, including peaks, in genomic short-read sequence data. Uses the binomial distribution with a local background model to automatically correct for broad-scale regional differences in tag levels.  It is applicable to a wide variety of epigenetic profiling assays, including ChIP-seq and DNase-seq.  Hotspot forms the basis of the SPOT data quality metric.
name: hotspot
title: Hotspot

description: STAR (Spliced Transcript Alignment to a Reference) aligns short and long RNA-seq reads to a reference genome using uncompressed suffix arrays.
name: star
title: STAR

description: Aligns single-end reads by BWA for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-align-bwa-se
title: dnase-align-bwa-se

description: Merges and filters paired-end aligned reads for quality and UMI duplicates for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-filter-pe
title: dnase-filter-pe

description: A set of tools (in Java) for working with next generation high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data in the BAM format.  Picard is implemented using the HTSJDK Java library HTSJDK, supporting accessing of common file formats, such as SAM and VCF, used for high-throughput sequencing data.  Currenty no published paper for Picard software.
name: picard
title: Picard

description: Measures consistency between replicates in high-throughput experiments.  Also uses reproducibility in score rankings between peaks in each replicate to determine an optimal cutoff for significance.  The core IDR R package can be downloaded from the IDR download page: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/idr/index.html
name: idr
title: Irreproducible Discovery Rate (IDR)

description: Irreproducible Discovery Rate (IDR) calculation from two replicates for Rampage ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: rampage-idr
title: rampage-idr

description: Performs common genomic analysis tasks and offers improved flexibility, scalability and execution time characteristics over previously published packages. The suite includes a utility to compress large inputs into a lossless format that can provide greater space savings and faster data extractions than alternatives.
name: bedops
title: BEDOPS

description: Indexes the reference genome by BWA, and processes mappability and blacklist for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-index-bwa
title: dnase-index-bwa

description: Aligns paired-end reads by STAR for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-align-star-pe
title: lrna-align-star-pe

description: The bigWig format is for display of dense, continuous data that will be displayed in the Genome Browser as a graph. BigWig files are created initially from wiggle (wig) type files, using the program wigToBigWig. The resulting bigWig files are in an indexed binary format. The main advantage of the bigWig files is that only the portions of the files needed to display a particular region are transferred to UCSC, so for large data sets bigWig is considerably faster than regular wiggle files.
name: wigtobigwig
title: wigToBigWig

description: Samtools is a suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data.  SAMtools implements various utilities for post-processing alignments in the SAM format, such as indexing, variant caller and alignment viewer, and thus provides universal tools for processing read alignments (PMID:19505943).
name: samtools
title: Samtools

description: Calculated correlation beteen two replicate signals for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-rep_corr
title: dnase-rep-corr

description: Several basic utility functions including: moving (rolling, running) window statistic functions, read/write for GIF and ENVI binary files, fast calculation of AUC, LogitBoost classifier, base64 encoder/decoder, round-off-error-free sum and cumsum, etc.
name: caTools
title: caTools

description: Aligns paired-end reads by TopHat for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-align-tophat-pe
title: lrna-align-tophat-pe

description: The snow package provides support for simple parallel computing on a network of workstations using R.  A master R process calls makeCluster to start a cluster of worker processes; the master process then uses functions such as clusterCall and clusterApply to execute R code on the worker processes and collect and return the results on the master. This framework supports many forms of "embarrassingly parallel" computations.
name: snow
notes: Used for DNase bam evaluation for phantompeaktools run_spp.R.  Installed from http://cran.cnr.berkeley.edu/
title: snow

description: This is a focused collection of makefiles and scripts to for analysis on Illumina sample data. While this probably can't be directly used by someone not in our lab, it might be a useful reference for others.
name: stampipes
notes: We use several tools from this repository for DNase processing.
title: StamPipes

description: Signal generation for Rampage ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: rampage-signals
title: rampage-signals

description: Calls hotspots and peaks on filtered alignments by hotspot2 for DNase ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dnase-call-hotspots
title: dnase-call-hotspots

description: Used to generate three quality metrics: NSC, RSC, and PBC.  The NSC (Normalized strand cross-correlation) and RSC (relative strand cross-correlation) metrics use cross-correlation of stranded read density profiles to measure enrichment independently of peak calling. The PBC (PCR bottleneck coefficient) is an approximate measure of library complexity. PBC is the ratio of (non-redundant, uniquely mappable reads)/(uniquely mappable reads).
name: phantompeakqualtools
title: Phantompeakqualtools

description: A ChIP-seq peak calling algorithm, implemented as an R package, that accounts for the offset in forward-strand and reverse-strand reads to improve resolution, compares enrichment in signal to background or control experiments, and can also estimate whether the available number of reads is sufficient to achieve saturation, meaning that additional reads would not allow identification of additional peaks. SPP will be used in the ENCODE 3 uniform peak calling pipeline.
name: spp
title: SPP

description: Indexing of reference genome by TopHat for long-RNA-seq ECODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-index-tophat
title: lrna-index-tophat

description: Collectively, the bedtools utilities are a swiss-army knife of tools for a wide-range of genomics analysis tasks. The most widely-used tools enable genome arithmetics: that is, set theory on the genome. For example, bedtools allows one to intersect, merge, count, complement, and shuffle genomic intervals from multiple files in widely-used genomic file formats such as BAM, BED, GFF/GTF, and VCF.
name: bedtools
title: BEDTools

description: Mean Absolute Deviation (MAD) and correlation calculated from two replicates for long-RNA-seq ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: lrna-mad-qc
title: lrna-mad-qc

description: The sva package in Bioconductor contains functions for removing batch effects and other unwanted variation in high-throughput experiment.
name: sva
title: Surrogate Variable Analysis

description: Indexes reference (and lambda) genomes using bismark and bowtie2, creating an archive file need for WGBS dna-methylation mapping of the ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dme-index-bismark-bowtie2
title: dme-index-bismark-bowtie2

description: Converts WGBS Bismark generated bedGraphs to bigWig format signal files for ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: dme-bg-to-signal
title: dme-bg-to-signal

description: Mean Absolute Deviation (MAD) and correlation calculated from two replicates for Rampage ENCODE uniform processing pipeline.
name: rampage-mad-qc
title: rampage-mad-qc

description: Remove reads from a BAM file based on a number of criteria
name: edwBamFilter
title: edwBamFilter
